message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.HC, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a machine learning algorithm for personalized risk scoring of critical care patients based on their physiological data streams. The algorithm uses a mixture of Gaussian Process experts and self-taught transfer learning to capture the heterogeneity of the patient population and transfer knowledge from clinically stable patients to deteriorating patients. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the algorithm is designed to provide timely and granular assessments for clinical acuity, which involves human-computer interaction and decision-making, indicating that the paper may also belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of physiological data streams and risk scoring in critical care also suggests that the paper may belong to the Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science (cs.CE) sub-category. Finally, the use of latent class models and transfer learning in the algorithm suggests that the paper may also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category.
